alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 08 at 8:33PM CST until February 10 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of west central Arkansas and Oklahoma, including the following counties, in west central Arkansas, Franklin and Sebastian. In Oklahoma, Latimer, Le Flore, Pushmataha and Sequoyah. * WHEN...Until 500 AM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Low-water crossings may be inundated with water and not passable. This area has received between 3 and 5 inches over the past 24 hours. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 PM CST, Trained weather spotters reported flooding in the warned area. Some county roads just south of the Arkansas River and to the northeast of Lavaca are reported to be flooded over. The water will be slow to recede overnight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Smith... Poteau... Charleston... Greenwood... Barling... Pocola... Heavener... Lavaca... Spiro... Arkoma... Panama... Talihina... Wister... Hackett... Howe... Altus... Hartford... Huntington... Bonanza... Bokoshe... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
